description: Set in a medieval village that is haunted by a werewolf, a young girl falls for an orphaned woodcutter, much to her family's displeasure.
keywords: half sister,werewolf horror,whodunit,younger version of character,dumping a dead body in a lake
name: Red Riding Hood

review.name: Catherine Hardwicke Ruins Another Film
review.reviewBody:
Set in a medieval village that is haunted by a werewolf, a not-so-young girl (Amanda Seyfried) falls for an orphaned woodcutter, much to her family's displeasure.

I have always enjoyed the story and imagery of Red Riding Hood, and think it has the proper material to make a great horror film (indeed, others have tried and had various degrees of success). But somehow, director Catherine Hardwicke decided she was going to make the worst possible version imaginable.

This is, sadly, more like her "Twilight" film than anything else. A teenage girl (though Seyfried, like Kristen Stewart, is actually years old) who is attracted to a pale guy with terrible hair... and we throw a werewolf in there... and heck, why not add Billy Burke as the girl's father? Very disappointing. The color scheme, the thin plot, everything points to this being a pre-teen romance film and not horror, and that is just unforgivable.

Why Gary Oldman agreed to this film is beyond me. And how Hardwicke was able to take such talent and waste it is an even bigger mystery...

trailer.description: In a twist on the fairy tale, Valerie, a young woman torn between two men. plans on escaping her village with her true love. But when her sister is killed by a werewolf in the dark forest near her home, Valerie soon realizes that she has a special connection to the beast.
trailer.name: Red Riding Hood: Trailer #2
